# Learning objectives 

## Learning objectives 

1. Understand Rust's ownership system
2. Work with the borrow checker 
3. Implement the right ownership model at the right time

# What Is Ownership?

```rust
let x2 = x;
println!("{x}");
```

## String literals are slices

```rust
let hello = "hello";
there(hello);

fn there(hello2: &str) {
  println!("{hello2} there")
}
```

## `&str` as parameters

```rust
let hello = String::from("hello");
there(&hello);

fn there(hello2: &str) {
  println!("{hello2} there")
}
```
